ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Estimate the mean of a Gaussian vector, by choosing among a large collection of estimators. In particular it solves the problem of variable selection by choosing the best predictor among  predictors emanating from different methods as lasso, elastic-net, adaptive lasso, pls, randomForest. Moreover, it can be applied for choosing the tuning parameter in a Gauss-lasso procedure.

Estimate the mean of a Gaussian vector, by choosing among a large collection of estimators. In particular it solves the problem of variable selection by choosing the best predictor among  predictors emanating from different methods as lasso, elastic-net, adaptive lasso, pls, randomForest. Moreover, it can be applied for choosing the tuning parameter in a Gauss-lasso procedure.

name: r-linselect
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.1.6" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-linselect
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/LINselect_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/LINselect/LINselect_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: b9c64b48e2cf08cc533a54311c43c48d427f27bc39fe2154630b43236db4f517

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-mass
    - r-elasticnet
    - r-gtools
    - r-mvtnorm
    - r-pls
    - r-randomforest
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-mass
    - r-elasticnet
    - r-gtools
    - r-mvtnorm
    - r-pls
    - r-randomforest

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('LINselect')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('LINselect')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=LINselect
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later
  summary: Estimate the mean of a Gaussian vector, by choosing among a large collection of estimators. In particular it solves the problem of variable selection by choosing the best predictor among  predictors emanating from different methods as lasso, elastic-net, adaptive lasso, pls, randomForest. Moreover, it can be applied
    for choosing the tuning parameter in a Gauss-lasso procedure.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: LINselect
# Title: Selection of Linear Estimators
# Version: 1.1.1
# Date: 2017-04-20
# Author: Yannick Baraud, Christophe Giraud, Sylvie Huet
# Maintainer: ORPHANED
# Description: Estimate the mean of a Gaussian vector, by choosing among a large collection of estimators. In particular it solves the problem of variable selection by choosing the best predictor among  predictors emanating from different methods as lasso, elastic-net, adaptive lasso, pls, randomForest. Moreover, it can be applied for choosing the tuning parameter in a Gauss-lasso procedure.
# Imports: mvtnorm, elasticnet, MASS, randomForest, pls, gtools, stats
# Depends: R (>= 3.6.0)
# License: GPL (>= 3)
# Encoding: latin1
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2019-03-07 09:55:59 UTC; ripley
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-04-26 13:20:38 UTC
# X-CRAN-Original-Maintainer: Annie Bouvier <Annie.Bouvier@inra.fr>
# X-CRAN-Comment: Orphaned on 2018-06-09 as maintainer has retired and her email address now bounces.
